io.vulpine.util.cli.def

Interface CliArgumentInterface<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HasDescription, HasHelpText, HasName
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CliArgument, CliFlag

    public interface CliArgumentInterface<T>
extends HasName, HasDescription, HasHelpText

    CLI Argument

    Shorthand Argument Key

    A shorthand key is a single dash, single character form for an argument.

    Valid characters for shorthand keys include letter characters, numbers, and any other single characters not given special treatment by your CLI environment.

    Examples
    # Valid
  -a
  -1 -2 -3
  -?
  -_

# Likely Invalid
  -'
  -"
  -*
  -\
  --

    Shorthand keys, when provided a parameter, do not require the parameter value to be assigned using an equals character. This is, however a supported feature, meaning both of the following are correct:

     -t=yes
 -v "extra"

    Full Argument Key

    A long-form key is defined by 2 dashes followed by one or more characters.

    Valid characters for long-form keys include letter characters, numbers, dashes, and underscore characters.

    Examples
      --this-is-valid
  --this/is/not
  --this_works_too
  --42

    Long-form keys, unlike shorthand keys, require an equals character directly between the name definition and the parameter value. This is not a technical limitation, but rather a convention for CLI applications. This limitation may be removed in future versions.

    # Valid
  --this="is okay"
  --so-is=this

# Invalid
  --this = "is not"
  --this "isn't either"
    Since:
    0.0.4

      • isRequired

        boolean isRequired()

        Gets whether or not this Argument is required.

        Required arguments provide an alternative to parameters, allowing required values to be provided in an arbitrary order.

        Returns:
        whether or not this argument is required by it’s parent component.
